About Syed Bokhari

NDIS Behaviour Support Practitioner (ID: P1636047)

Professional Background

Supporting Participants with Respect, Insight & Evidence

I am an NDIS Behaviour Support Practitioner deemed suitable by the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission. My work focuses on understanding the function of behaviour, building practical skills, and supporting participants to live safer, more independent, and more meaningful lives.

My approach is grounded in Positive Behaviour Support (PBS), trauma-informed practice, and a strong commitment to human rights. I work collaboratively with families, Support Coordinators, and providers to ensure strategies are practical, respectful, and aligned with each participant‚Äôs goals.

My Practice Philosophy

Every plan is grounded in dignity, safety, and evidence.

üë§

Person-Centred

Every strategy is tailored to the participant‚Äôs strengths, preferences, and goals.

üß†

Trauma-Informed

Recognising the impact of past experiences and ensuring support is safe, respectful, and predictable.

üìä

Evidence-Informed

Using Functional Behaviour Assessments (FBA) and data to guide meaningful, sustainable change.

Compliance & Clinical Governance

My practice aligns with the NDIS Capability Framework and the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission requirements. Behaviour Support Plans are developed with a focus on safety, skill-building, and the reduction or elimination of restrictive practices.

üìù Practitioner Registration Details: Suitable NDIS Behaviour Support Practitioner (ID: P1636047). Services delivered in accordance with the NDIS (Restrictive Practices and Behaviour Support) Rules 2018, including all state-based authorisation and reporting requirements.
